div.p: RANDIA in botany : A genus of the monogynia order, belonging to the pentandria clafs of plants ; and in the natural method ranking with thofe of which the order is doubtful. The calyx is monophyllous ; the corolla ſalver-ſhaped ; the berry unilocular, with a cap-ſular rind. There are two ſpecies, viz. the mitis and aςuleata.
